result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie Kay Pagel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Comply with and successfully complete Impaired Driving Court (IDC).

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 7/8/22 by 6:00 p.m.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Probation Intake Order
misc. info

3:37 PM Defendant Valerie Kay Pagel in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark S Sweet in court for Valerie Kay Pagel. Court reviews agreement, charges and penalties. Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1. Court makes findings and enters conviction. Sentencing arguments given. Defendant makes statement. Discussion held on impaired driving court (IDC). Court heard and imposes the following sentence;

**w/held
- 24 mo probation w/ following conditions;
- 60 days DCJ w/ work release & transfer to commence on 7/8
- $1,200 fine
- $26 blood draw fee
- DNA/surcharge
- Court costs & driver impairment surcharges
- Complete Dodge Co. Impaired Driving Court
- AODA assessment & follow through w/ all recommendations
- Absolute sobriety
- No bars, taverns, liquor stores, etc.
- No operating a motor vehicle w/o valid DL
- 24 mo revocation
- 24 mo IID
- BAC .170

To report to probation tomorrow 7/8 before 4:00 PM
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on July 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

12:56 PM Defendant Valerie Kay Pagel in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (not eligible).  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Valerie Kay Pagel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
